Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ho Chi Minh City, null, Vietnam
Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Moonseok C
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel ever... Room is too small and even smelled. Price is also expensive. Staffs are not friendly at all. They don't smiles. I won't go this hotel again and won't recomend for all people. If you go there, it's wasting money and you will be angry.

Reviews.Title: “Location and rooms may not suit everyone, but everything else .....”
Reviews.Author: Cocoda-Cambridge
Reviews.Content: 5 nights on my first trip to Singapore. I'd read enough reviews to know the rooms were tiny, many had no windows and the location was considered suspect by some. I was lucky to get a window and the rooms are small, but this is Singapore and you shouldn't be wasting time in your room. Little India is just that and may be more 'colourful' than other areas but it's not remotely unsafe. Plenty of cheap restaurants and nothing is far by cab or MRT. However, free WiFi, breakfast, mini bar and 5 cocktails per night are a major major plus. Lovely, helpful and friendly service at all times tops off a very good priced hotel in Singapore. Would definitely recommend but don't be afraid to venture further afield too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: jdoafc
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived hone having stated at the moon for two nights. This is a fine place to stay and would stay here again if I ever go back to Singapore. The hotel is extremely clean throughout. The room we had was very small with no window which didn't bother us because we was up early and in bed late I spoke with a bloke in the bar who had complained about not having a window and his room was changed immediately. The bed was really comfy and the whole place was cosy. About 20 minutes in a taxi which cost around s$20. The mrt station is a nice 5 minute walk through little India this area is completely different to the city and was nice to experience a few different cultures of Singapore. ... A great place

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, cosy~”
Reviews.Author: YellowHorse
Reviews.Content: If its for a short trip and if u do not have huge luggages, its a great place! It was S$140 before taxes, early bird weekday rate. Small twin room but it has all u need, and more, eg. fridge, wardrobe, iphone dock/charge player, bed room slippers. The rooms are very new and we love the comfy mattress. There's discovery channel and national geographic, yeah! Take a stroll around the vicinity and u will see a different Singapore. Its quaint and nostalgic, away form the crowded streets of Singapore. I saw an altar with a statue of a God tucked away at a corner, and also a makeshift barber stall that was found in the good old 60s-70s. Note that its a one way street. Hotel do not have parking lots. Parking spaces are pretty rare. Google map shows that MRT stations (Little India/Bugis) is around 600m-700m away.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Little India”
Reviews.Author: CSom
Reviews.Content: Having been staying at the Moon a few times as a short getaway, we've found moon an absolute gem in Singaore. It is a compact boutique located in the Little India area very near the Bugis or the Little India MRT stations. The rooms are neat, clean and compact, perfect for those who are on short trips in Singapore. The bed is set Japanese style on a raised platform. You'll find a small working area on one side of the bed. All the mini bar items in the room are free. There's also a cocktail hour in the evening at the reception/lounge area. The staff is very friendly, and after staying there a couple of times, they fully remember our room preferences. Some of the rooms may not have windows at all, if you are clustrophobic, do ask for room with window.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: dirty8super
Reviews.Content: Stopped for one night. Bed was very comfy. Room small but designed well. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, clean, modern style”
Reviews.Author: Xhavier
Reviews.Content: The Moon hotel is A good one, the staff is perfect, rooms are clean but small and without windows but for a short stay it s the perfect hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Tim-from-Australia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an area known as Little India, it's over a hundred a night but thats cheap for Singapore. The room has a weird split level design with the bed (mattress) on a raised bedroom area with an strange coffee/tea table around the corner. The split level design made it a bit uncomfortable getting up and down from the bed to the bathroom, especially during the night. The shower was great, but the hot water was a bit short for me. It was about $25 by taxi from the airport. Breakfast was ok, the eggs were a bit dry, but there was also cereal, fruit, juice, tea, coffee, bread/toast and pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you suffer from cabin fever”
Reviews.Author: Damobet
Reviews.Content: A 3 star review might be a bit unfair because I did know what I was getting in to when I booked the hotel, but in reality I won't be staying here again, at least in a standard room. The hotel does a lot / the majority of things really well. Modern, comfortable, attention to detail. The shower is awesome! Mini bar is a great touch, breakfast and internet inclusion are big +++ The fact that the room has no windows was a problem. I arrived late a night so it is not an issue then. I knew this would be the case when I booked, but thought I would be fine. But try spending any amount of daylight hours in a small room with no natural light... it drove me crazy! For solo travellers spending most of their time out and about, looking for a good priced hotel, I would recommend this. For couples I would definitely not recommend. Business travellers, also no! Location is pretty good. Walking distance to lots of cheap good food. I would recommend the chicken rice at Sim Lim Square :)

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Al S
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is very nicely designed with lots of attention paid to the little details. I stayed here during the Singapore Formula 1 Grand Prix and they had decorated the lobby in F1 style and the staff were dressed in F1-style pit crew uniforms. The rooms are small - very small. Some are only a metre or two bigger than the bed, but the beds are incredible. Memory foam mattresses, pillows, etc., make it difficult to get out of bed. The hotel seems expensive, but the minibar is included in the room price and restocked daily (2 beers, 2 juices, 2 waters, 2 sodas), breakfast is included and fresh tea/coffee is available in the lobby and after 5pm, they serve complimentary cocktails. The little extras make the stay pleasurable. The staff are OK, but not the friendliest.

Reviews.Title: “Something different right in Little India”
Reviews.Author: flydanair
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel - sticks out a little bit in little India for that reason. Reasonably priced considering singapore prices. I am not sure how old it was but some of the taxi drivers hadnt heard of it - but yet knew the road it was on. Staff were helpful, good breakfast included - rooms are very small - the size is shown on their website just so your aware. The main reason i have marked it as average was that the floor i was on (at least) and my room smelt a bit damp - i just had that feeling whilst i was there also that damp was in the air. the air conditioning unit was noisy and would not turn off, nor could i adjust the temperature. Also the TV stopped working half way into my first day. I didnt spend a lot of time in the hotel, so some might say who cares, but whilst i really wanted to love it and love its hip modern vibe in the old Little India I could only rate it Average. If i could rate the staff i would say very good (in my experience with them) . One reason i didnt request to move rooms - i was only staying two nights and was jet lagged plus visiting family who live in Singapore so that was my main focus - i did see a few people complaining / requesting room changes and it seemed to be a lot of hassle (maybe they were full?) but one guy was there for 45 minutes whilst i had a slow breakfast on the first morning trying to move rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImranJ
Reviews.Content: The room is nicely designed. The toilet has a rain shower head. Its toiletries were also quite good. However, one problem I faced was that as the bed was placed on an elevated platform, we had to climb up and down the platform. This may become a problem for older people. Anyways breakfast was served in a small area at the lobby. The spread was not that amazing and it could get quite crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for a few days”
Reviews.Author: Tsar100
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights recently on the way though Singapore and was pleasantly surprised. Rooms were small by Western Standards but for a hotel in Asia for 1 or 2 people was very modern and well located. This hotel and rooms are not suited for families so don't do it. But for singles or couples great, included mini bar and wifi are a big tick, breakfast is not over the top but you can get a good feed and the 5 cocktails per room per day top it off well. I only negative is if you don't like Little India then keep away but if you like the real Singapore unpolished then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Trooper_UK
Reviews.Content: The "executive lounge" has a 5 drink per room maximum during cocktail hour (17:00 - 19:00) which is not mentioned on the website and I have never encountered before when using such lounges. We had an "executive" room which was tiny and be warned that approximately half of the rooms at the hotel have no windows at all (this is hidden in the small print on the website). The breakfast selection was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: bxc048
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Moon for four nights over Christmas, having read the reviews I was a bit dubious but was pleasantly surprised. It is true that most of the rooms are very small and don’t have windows, was this a problem, the answer is no. they are well though out, plenty of plugs ect... Free wifi thoughout the hotel. The staff were very friendly and seem to have a good team spirit laughing and joking with each other – very relaxed atmosphere but that isn’t to say unprofessional in any way. We booked online and didn’t pay for breakfast but when we check-in we were told breakfast, evening cocktails/beer (think a limit of five) and the mini bar were complimentary which was a pleasant surprise! Breakfast was a little chaotic – I think this may be due to it being Christmas and everybody moving on a similar schedule. It was pretty simple bread, pastries, cereal etc... fresh coffee and tea. There have been a few comments on the area, it is true to say Little India isn’t high rise and new like a lot of Singapore, there are now quite a few small higher end hotels in the area now. Dunlop Street which runs parallel has a more backpacker feel with a few bars and hostels. I would stay in the Moon again.

Reviews.Title: “The Moon- a decent stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 25-29 of december and found it was a relitavely decent hotel. Those who say it is in a dodgy area obviously havent been to other places in asia- Singapore is probably one of the cleanest areas, even little india! We found the location great, and just down the road from the very popular 'Wanderlust' so you can go to the restaurant there. Overall the reviews on this website are pretty correct, it is a small hotel room (not unusual for asia) but it is very well designed and compact, fitting everythign you pretty much need- unless you plan to do a lot of shopping in Singapore! Its pretty good for short stays, I wouldn't stay more than a week if space is a large issue. The smell of the hotel definately is 'signature' to the moon- it must be damp in the air conditioner or something. You find this a lot in Singapore because of the climate, but at the Moon it seemed rather intense. When we first booked in our room had no window, dissapointed as we had requested a window- we asked the helpful staff to change our room- and they did without a problem which was great. The room we got changed to was a lot smaller but with a large window which was great. The beds were amazingly comfortable, and the TV is fantastic. Wifi also a bonus! The free cocktails are a must! A great touch. We didnt eat the breakfast as there are so many amaizng food options in Singapore! The moon- not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Moon Hotel Singapore... Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: zoimeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it seemed ok in the pictures and since we were only staying here for one night then off to Malaysia. We arrived abit after 11pm. The lobby and decor was impressive but we knew as soon as we stepped into the lift that size realy does matter! The room itself for a midget would have been perfect, but for a couple of 'average' Australians, there was no room to move. It was basically a hop, skip and jump. Lucky was only there for 1 night as I was having serious claustrophobic issues due to their being no window. The bed was comfy. Didnt see the mini bar, perhaps it was hidden. Bathroom was nice, but again the actual toilet you couldnt properly sit down as your legs would be hitting the door so you had to position yourself another way. When having a shower you can see the person sleeping on the bed and vv. So not a good room for a sharing, non-intimate couple. The shower and pressure was amazing, the amenities were amazing, TV was great. But there was just no room, felt like a sardine. Breakfast was average, pastries were stale but got that everywhere in Singapore and Malaysia. But Ok since it was included in the price. Close to Mustafa 24/7 supermarket. Went at 5am as we were jet lagged and waiting for breakfast to open. This supermarket is huge! Glad to only have been here for one night, would of had to asked for an upgrade if here longer. Had nice xmas decorations.

Reviews.Title: “Only a few minor things preventing this from being an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Comfort_Traveller29
Reviews.Content: We stayed there December 28 - January 1. When searching online for a decent priced hotel in a good location, Moon Hotel seemed to be the best value during high season. It was at least $20/night cheaper than Wanderlust which is just down the street. The bed was super comfortable, complimentary minibar was a nice touch, great wifi in the room, although you had to login every time you wanted to go online, and we had a chance to take advantage of the happy hour at least twice because we came back to drop bags off, change before heading out for the night, and it was a nice touch with very friendly service. The few minor things preventing this from being an excellent hotel is the smell that hit you in the face everytime you stepped out of the elevator onto the third floor. It smelled like something had flooded or gotten wet, and never dried completely. I think perhaps there was a sufficient level of mold in the air or in the walls, because my allergies were horrendous unless I took my allergy pills religiously. The smell did go away as soon as we were in our room fortunately, but it was kind of a slap in the face every time we got off the elevator. I would suggest re-carpeting or tiling the entire third floor would be necessary. Breakfast was decent, it was super busy, and it seemed like food seemed to run out more quickly than they got around to stocking. The first night we arrived, the in-room safe showed low battery so we were concerned that we would not have access to our valuables upon our return. When we went out that night, we advised the front desk staff, and they said they would advise house-keeping. When we returned from our night out, they had not made any changes. In the morning, I saw house-keeping in the hall, and she told me to call the front desk. I called, and they sent someone up, who unscrewed the battery door, jiggled the battery, replaced the door, and asked if that was okay. We tried the safe again, and saw the same low battery reading. We asked him to change the battery which I'm not sure why he just didn't do in the first place. We asked for a late check-out New Year's Day on the off chance that it would be possible on the last night, and they said it would be okay to check-out at 1 pm instead of noon. Then we received a call at 11:45 am advising us of the check-out time being noon. I told the front desk staff that we had been told that it was okay to check out at 1 pm, and she said she would check. She immediately called back and said it would be okay to check out at 1 pm. The hugest benefit to this place aside from the very comfortable bed was the convenient location to the Little India MRT. I think the staff just has to be a little more consistent with their customer service and our hotel experience could have been improved. I hope I have the means to stay at a nicer place the next time I visit Singapore, but when in Singapore, how much time are you actually spending in your room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jkauffmann85
Reviews.Content: Singapore is expensive overall, however for the size of this room I felt I potentially overpaid. The room was the size of a queen bed and a bathroom and that was it! I visited Christmas Eve and Christmas night so prices were also peak season. However, the rooms did include free drinks in the minibar (2 waters, 2 Cokes, 2 beers), breakfast was free and was amazing! It was one of the best free breakfasts I have ever had. Also, the location was great. It was in the heart of Little India where you are close to fresh fruit markets, endless and inexpensive Indian food and the MRT subway system. The staff was ver nice and overall I would still visit them again as well as recommend them to friends because of the convenience and the things that were included also helped in compensating for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Moon hotel for 5 nights / 6 Days. Overall the hotel is quite average. Not worth 4 stars. For the first day, i stayed in a room with window and the room was too cramped. There was no space to open my suit case. The bathroom was cramped as well. Next day i got myself moved to a different room. It was window-less but relatively bigger than the previous room. Morning breakfast was again pretty average. Not many options for the vegetarian guys. The mocktail / cocktail in the evening are pretty average as they do not use fresh juices. They prepared the drinks from tetra packs. The reception area is quite smelly (may be it is a bad room freshener they used??). Room cleanup was pretty average. Hot water came out of the shower only for first five mins. Later the shower emitted cold / lukewarm water.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: zhengning
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Moon Hotel for to celebrate our anniversary. Prior to that, we were browsing through rooms and suites together online, and chanced upon this hotel. We decided on moon's moonlight suite though there were mixed reviews, but we were both pretty much attracted to the outdoor bathtub. And indeed, we had a great time together there. The room wasnt as spacious as i thought, but not too bad, i mean it's just two of us....definitely more than enough. There were free drinks in the fridge too, which was a bonus. The staff were professional, lovely, and really helpful. Thumbs up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Location OK, room a little small”
Reviews.Author: Fiona A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cheapest and probably smallest room. I think it was smaller than I had expected from the hotel website but the room rate was good so we didnt mind. Everything was clean and tidy, we had to climb up on a ledge to get into bed which was interesting since I cannot see without contact lenses and climbing in the middle of the night could spell disaster! We really only slept there so it served it's purpose, was difficult finding room to store 2 large cases though and there was an awful smell in the room at night, seemed to come from the drains maybe, the room has no windows to open and no ventilation in the day since the air con went off when we left the room. When we mentioned it we got a new key card to keep it running during the day. Would recommend short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms & Pricey Just Like Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: The mOOn hotel was not necessarily a bad hotel. It was a decent location, close to some good shopping, although that's never hard to find in Singapore, as the whole city just seems to be a big mall. My wife and I had a nice night there, we got the "executive" room, which was bigger than the standard rooms, so I can't imagine how small those are. One thing is there was no window in our room. There was a big curtain, but no window, just a plane wall behind the curtain. Also, after we checked in for a flight out, the lady at the airline wondered why we stayed in Little India, as it's the "red light" district. We never felt uncomfortable, but it was a bit "dirtier" than most of the rest of the city. Still, the hotel was close to the MRT station, so it was convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Sweet (Nov 2011)”
Reviews.Author: KeeTse
Reviews.Content: Hihi, me and my GF stayed at this hotel between the 11/11 - 13/11. a) It took us 30 - 40 mins from leaving the airport to walking through the door (which is very reasonable, we took the Bagis MTR exit) b) Upon our arrival we were greeted with some cold apple juice (nice touch!) c) The room is quite compact, with a good quality shower and a toilet inside the room behind a partitioned wall. (there is no shower curtain to separate the 2 facilities) d) The room is clean and the bed comfortable. e) THERE WAS NO WINDOW in the room!!!!!!!!!!!!...!!!!!!.. which I suppose didn't really matter much since we were out most of the time. f) The hotel is very close to the city center (Nearest MTR is Little India) g) the Hotel provided free Wifi. h) The free breakfast was sufficient, including toast, beans, fruit, yohurt, coffee, tea, juices, scrabbled eggs and cooked sausages. i) Taxis to the airport cost $16 and takes about 30 mins, Overall, the hotel was nice, it was what we paid for... the staff were friendly. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Mousehole”
Reviews.Author: rvijay53
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days. I had booked it through Expedia. First time when I saw the room I was shocked at its size. It is nothing but a mousehole. You just creep into the bed sleep and come out. If I had known the size I would not have gone for it. For the money they charge, better hotels are available in Little India itself. But whatever facilities they have are neat and clean. But I would not recommend this hotel for any one who needs a place to relax and refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Small as it gets, but great mattress & good service”
Reviews.Author: 2han
Reviews.Content: Our room was miniscule, the bathroom sink was in the room (not the one with the toilet and shower), the desk could barely hold anything on it. But the mattress and bedding were very nice, the breakfast was good, and the cocktail hour from 5-7 was definitely a reason to go home early. Good/cheap restaurants nearby. We booked the hotel, as we always do, on arrival at Singapore airport as they often have the most interesting/best deals and we're up for an adventure. PS-Don't go with someone you've never shared your smells with before!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Junior1573
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in the heart of Little India. We live in Singapore and stayed there for one night this past weekend to get away. For us it was great as we didn't have much luggage and were just there for the night. If you have a ton of luggage this may not be the best place as you'll be stepping over it. However, for the price, location and cleanliness it may be worth it. The staff were very friendly and checking in and out was seamless. Plus the whole place is very clean and comfortable. They have a cocktail hour in the evening and 5 drinks come with each room, plus you the in-room minibar is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Small but worth its price.”
Reviews.Author: Krimie
Reviews.Content: Small but cozy hotel, made it all up by providing useful amenities. Chanced upon this hotel when I was reading a travel mag. For those looking for promotion n staying at this hotel before 31st December 2011, quote "tigertales" in their website when booking to enjoy their promo! I didnt expect much from this hotel n indeed, it satisfied my expectations. I stayed in a deluxe room (with the bathtub) n yes, the room is small but the complimentary amenities make up for it. There's complimentary wi-fi, minibar (consisting of 2 cans of San Miguel beer, 2 cans of soft drinks, 2 bottles of fruit juice n 2 bottles of water), coffee n tea, cocktail hours from 5-7pm n of cos, breakfast. Wasn't a wide spread but enough to satisfy the morning tummy. Toiletries provided were more than enough; shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, shower cap, loofah, shaver, toothbrushes, sewing kit n even a nail buffer. Stayed with my bf but they only provided one pair of bathroom slippers n one bathrobe. But it's fine, don't mind walking barefooted as the hotel is very clean. Cozy for 2 persons' stay n short term only. I stayed for a night.

Reviews.Title: “fly me to the moon”
Reviews.Author: GregMcT
Reviews.Content: i have never been a great singapore fan. being an older traveller i can remember when singapore was less sterile and much better value for money. last week i had to come to singapore for work after having avoided it for 10 years. The budget and the fact it was rip-off time i.e. the Singapore grand prix forced me to look for affordable accommodation - as there were 6 of us. I looked at the Moon Hotel and read the reviews. Basically since there was little choice we came here but boy I am glad were weren't paying £300 per night elsewhere. I actually found the concept both cute and very practical. Sure the rooms are small and there is no window (at least 2 of the group did have one with a window) but it was very practical in its layout. Even those who say a case is a problem are exaggerating. A case can easily fit on the floor between the wall and the bed. And water going everywhere in the bathroom - well a shower screen would be nice but only messy people put water everywhere. And we found the staff really helpful. Our booking was slightly messed up by the online company but they worked through things. The free drinks and nibbles do exist - for the drunks among you can get 5 bottles of stella artois plus a further 2 cans of san miguel all for free. And breakfast was more than passable. We were there at 8. At most hotels if you go for breakfast at 10 you are struggling to get premium service. The big plus for me is that the moon is in the little india area and arab street and bugis are not that far away. I had forgooten those parts of singapore where there is some culture. There are two hawker stalls close by and tow quite reasonable supermarkets so everything you need. No need to go to Orchard Road unless you have loads of money. Buy a card to travle around and get it charged up. Don't buy one of those visitors passes they are a rip off. You have to pay a deposit for a card and charge it up. Short distances in the city cost about 80 cents per trip - a far cry from the £4 per trip in London. You can get to the moon from changi by MRT although you need one change and then to Bugis. It's about 500 metre walk from Bugis

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: Toujours_plus_haut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights back in October 2010, and the hotel had only been opened for about a month. Moon Hotel is located in Dickson road, a quiet side street in the otherwise bustling Little India. The reception area is decorated in a minimalistic style and gives a good first impression. I can only echo other posters comments about the size of the rooms. My room was supposedly 18 sqm but felt less, and there was no place to sit down apart from on the bed which was located on an elevated platform one-two steps up from the floor. The interior was kind of industrial chic, and I quite liked it. It's stripped down to bare necessities, but doesn't leave you missing anything. It was also very clean. The bathroom had a shower over bath and glass walls which may be a problem if you're sharing with someone you'd rather not be that private with. On a positive side, the bed was super comfy! Also, the room had an ipod dock and free drinks in a mini-fridge. The breakfast buffet was good, and every evening the lobby bar have a happy hour with a selection of free cocktails. I'd be happy to stay here again, despite the rooms being a little small. The price I paid and the location right in the middle of Little India located near my favourite restaurants (for example Sitara, opposite Mustafa) weighs up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: AlexM1979
Reviews.Content: Very small room (with no window) but Singapore's not a city you come to sit around in the hotel all day, so that wasn't a problem. Well-appointed, decent location (some nice little bars nearby and a short walk to the National Museum etc), breakfast was very good although you have to get there early as there aren't enough tables if the hotel is full. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Just what you need from a mid-range big-city crash pad, really.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay but small room”
Reviews.Author: Jose B
Reviews.Content: very clean room located in little india,room was clean but very small. Free drinks in fridge was a nice touch. A good choice in a very expensive city

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last September when we were there for the F1 racing. The hotel has literally just opened that week. I chosse this hotel as the prices for hotels during the F1 were really expensive and we got a good deal with this one. The staff were all very friendly and were often offering to get us a sott drink or coffee whenever we were coming in or out. The rooms are very small, much smaller than I had gathered from the photos. The first room was exceptionally small, really not big enough for 2 people and once I came out a shower I realised there was no mirror anywhere, and I had to dry my hair! When I called down to reception then let me know not all rooms have a mirror but they were able to move me. The next room was bigger, it was still really small but much better than the 1st one. The bed was really comfortable and the TV was huge, plus the fridge was handy so if you just want a base and plan to be out most of the time then it's fine. There were nice towels and amenities in the room and it was a proper hairdryer. The hotel is in a good location, we have been to Singapore before and were on Orchard Road so it was good to be in a different part of the city this time. There are 2 MRT stations within walking distance, Little India you can get to if you turn left outside the hotel and Bugis if you go left. They are no more than a ten minute walk and there are Hawker Centres and shops along the way! This is area is definitely lower scale than Orchard Road but we felt perfectly safe walking about and the mall at Bugis is really nice, with lots of shops, restaurants and a cinema inside and there is a good outdoor market next to it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet clean & well decorated boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Noshe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Moon hotel for three days during our 10 days trip to Singapore for medical checkup. The hotel rent is cheaper compared to other hotels in Singapore offering the same standard. Rooms are very small but the interior decoration is done in such a way that you dont feel that the room is small. We have two small hand carrys so for us it was not much of a problem with the space. The bed was comfortable and room was very clean. The buffet breakfast was also included in the room rent as well as they also arranged free drinks in the evening. Bugis and Little India station is 10 mins walk from the hotel. Overall the stay in Moon Hotel was good as it offered comfort in a smaller way in the expensive city of Singapore. Will suggest to those who don't want to spend much in hotel but at the same time wants to stay in a clean, well decorated hotel with all facilities.

Reviews.Title: “good for one night, not longer”
Reviews.Author: FerrariFanatic
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly. At first sight the hotel looks excellent, nice design and offers some nice additional, free services such as the wifi and five free cocktails. However, all this is necessary to make up for some fundamental flaws in the rooms. During our stay, we were asked to change rooms three times for a four-night stay. the airconditioning broke down (i.e. Water everywhere), no window in the room which prohibits getting some fresh air into the room, mold in some places and everything in the room felt humid. All in all, given its price, good for a one-night stay, but to be avoided for a relaxing holiday stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: coaxkgbh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. OK it's small, lets get that out of the way...but I challenge anyone to find better value in Singapore. I could not be more pleased (actually would have been awesome if they had a pool!). I'll be back. Staff were very friendly and great, it's in a lively area and close to everything. Bed was amazingly comfortable and room maids kept everything nice and fresh. Cool little hangout for a couple of days in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but comfy one”
Reviews.Author: Cal_TheHotelLover
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking at Moon Hotel. Wanted to try this place quite some time back. My first expression was. Wow! Clean and simple lobby! Follow by their extra ordinary small rooms! My thoughts change when I lie down on their super comfy bed. I can say this out loud, this could be one of the most comfortable bed in a hotel for less than $200. Might not suitable for travelers with large suitcase, but if you're looking for a stay with a nice bed after a long day, this will be the one. Will try their Moon Suite one day :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice small room without window”
Reviews.Author: Milford11
Reviews.Content: Room was recently renovated and clean which was desirable. However, room was small and there was no window. Air conditioning worked very well. For us, as we stayed only one night, stay was OK.

Reviews.Title: “No go”
Reviews.Author: BorodBorod
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks much more pretentious than it actually is. I am used to small rooms and I am not picky about cleaniness at all, but this was SMALL and DIRTY. When I say small, it means that if you are an average size person, it will be literally you and 1 bag that fits in the room. If there is more than one person, you companion will have to either lay on the bed or stay in the bathroom because there is no room. The sink was in the room which made it even smaller. And the bathroom had a toilet and a shower over the toilet. I am a very small girl, and it was tiny even for me. On the positive side, they offer a free breakfast (or breakfast was included in the price we paid) and it was decent; they also offer a tray of bathroom goodies in the room that contains more items than a hotel of this level would normally offer (like several lotion options, manicure items, bath items), they had an ipod player in the room - BUT I would trade all of these for them actually cleaning the room. It was noticeably dirty, the bathroom was dirty, and it was quite obvious that the room has not been actually cleaned in a while. Their ventilation system is horrible because it would blow smoke from other rooms. They play music in halls and we could hear it through the closed door. I would not stay there if I were to come back. Again, it looks really nice at first, but then it is just an image that falls apart if you actually stay there. The location was good, close to MRT, in the heart of Little India, close to Arab street, but there are other hotels that I am sure could offer more for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ksteff
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a boutique hotel located in a very cool area. It was very easy to find located about 5 minute walk from one of the train/subway stations. Overall the hotel was very nice, the room set-up though was different. It was very small and about 50% is up on a platform that is about knee level. It was very different although not bad. They had free appetizers / drinks during happy hour which was cool with the exception that I got bad food poisoning off the tuna. Minus the food poisoning we had a great experience here! Just don't eat their apps just take advantage of the drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for trip to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Calv2002
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel in the Little India district. Staying here will give you a more authentic experience of Singapore, than staying in one of the Marina area hotels. It is a short walk to the Little India MRT. Despite some reviews logged here, it is perfectly safe (as is the rest of Singapore) to walk around any time of the day or night. Some rooms have no windows and yes they are small, but this is Singapore - you aren't really going to want to stay in your room long. Bed was really comfortable, shower was excellent, breakfast was adequate. Free beer in the fridge was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and nice designed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AxelhotelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in this great Hotel. It is a small Boutique Hotel in Singapor, located in Little India. We had the Moonlight Suite and this was absolutly Amazing. Two Rooms on the roof devided from a Huge terrace and a big Bathtube outside. We really had a Blast during this time. The Minibar is inclusive like the nice and small breakfast in the morning.There is a Cocktailhour in the evening in the Lobby to enjoy and relax after a long Sightseeing or Shopping Tour. The staff is really friendly and helpfull.If you like the indian Spirit it will be the best location for you.From the metro Station Little India you will come to all important places in a really short time. It is already clear that during our next Singapore stay we like to stay again in the Moon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cramped hotel in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: traveller1093
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very very small, you could barely moved around in the room. The rooms did not have any windows. The area in which the hotel is located was trashy. All in all in was not value for money. DO NOT believe the pictures, it is MISLEADING!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice rooms, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KravelBug
Reviews.Content: Pros: free cocktail and bar fridge drinks, breakfast was average bed was comfortable very modern looking Stayed for 5 nights. two of us but gave us one slipper one bathrobe room ammeneties were not replenished daily. small room some breakfast items were revolting, uncooked rice pumpkin was too salty.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, but good value to save money”
Reviews.Author: Acmeyer753
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Singapore for a week, the first half I stayed at a more pricey hotel, which led me to search for something more affordable. While the rooms are nothing more than a shower, toilet, TV and Bed, the things included in your stay make it worth your while. I was given free cocktails every night of my stay including a free mini bar in my room, free wireless internet, and a breakfast every morning! These things are un heard of in singapore where beer is usually 10-20$ a drink and breakfast or internet comes at a high cost. So if you don't mind a smaller room and plan on enjoying singapore outside the hotel, this place is perfect! No other place I have seen offers all of these things.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: chickenchop123
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay there. Service was excellent, always served w a smile. Booked the delux room w bath tub but it was way too small for our comfort but we were allowed to choose a much spacious room w window but standing shower. Shower room was spacious. Room although small but v cosy and comfortable. Variety of channels for tv available. Mini bar was vvv appreciated w 2 beers 2 mineral water 2 fruit juice and 2 carbonated drink, all complimentary. Free 5 cocktails/spirits/house pours per room from 5 to 7. Complimentary breakfast was delicious. Not many variety but was enough and hearty. Overall experience was worth the price considering the complimentary mini bar, house pours and breakfast. Would def visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: DavideBali
Reviews.Content: Coming from Africa and Europe, after a 2 and half months away from home ( I am living in Bali). I had to visit Embassy of Angola and had to stop just 1 night, so I decided to try this Hotel. For short staying I used to book Ibis Hotel nearby, but Moon Hotel is better in my opinion. With cheaper price you can get a cozy room (sure it's small, but have everything), great staff, very helpful, good breakfast, mini bar and internet included in the room rate. I just would like to tell to all the people who compares this Hotel with 81 budget hotel or similar, to go there next time and try to see the difference. Of course with SGD 200 what can you expect more? Have a look to the other hotel's price and let's compare. I think everybody will like to have a 5 star hotel facilities with a budget hotel price!!! It's a dream!!! Overall recommended to solo travelers or young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Doing the best they can with TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: bigmaninalittleland
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Moon Hotel and many things were very good. -staff was helpful -rooms were new and clean -mini bar was free!!! -free happy hour in the lobby nightly So I guess you'd say: "Wow, sounds fantastic!" but now the bad side. -rooms were TINY ( I cannot stress this enough). there was nowhere to put your luggage, you had to crawl around, the entire room (bathroom and all) was the size of a walk in closet. -there are no windows in the room. -the floors are concrete. -the rooms are very dark. If you are a solo traveler or someone who is familiar with Japanese sleeper capsules you'll be fine (there are many positives to this place) but if you are traveling with partner, or someone who appreciates a bit of square footage. Forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Safeera87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hidden in Little India. Was a bit sceptical when we walked into the area and street, but when we arrived it was just like in the pictures. Very classy and modern hotel. We had the option between a room with or without window. The last one is more spacious, but we still went for a room with window since we would be there only for two nights. Loved the whole layout and interior of the room. They don't skimp on the details in this hotel. The bathroom has a see through wall and a rain shower, which I loved! one of the best showers I ever had in a hotel. Breakfast was superb, a lot of choice for a continental breakfast. Staff is very helpful and professional. Location was ok, not too far from MTR station and lots of malls nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pls do not stay at moon!”
Reviews.Author: Yo0
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room with a so called long bath tub. Apparently the bath tub was no bigger then any normal tub. It was utterly disappointing. Paid $240 to stay in a one star hotel... The breakfast was the most pathetic ever. Bottom-line dun b fooled by the photos on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Room size of a prison”
Reviews.Author: Lowpack
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the smallest room I have ever seen. I would guess it was not bigger than the cell of a prison. The place where you can walk is about 10 feet. There is only a bed, no windows, a small shower, and of course no place for a chair or table. You have to watch TV from the bed. It's not a room, it's a cell. I heard that Japan has places like this, but never thought I would find it in Singapore. What disturbed me the most was, that you can look into the toilet. So you can see your partner doing business. If you want to get a real breakfast, you better be an early bird. They claim to serve the last meal at 10:15, but if you are there at 9:30, you won't get a proper meal no more: No eggs left, no bread. And the beans were cold. And don't expect to have any cream cheese, diet jam. They don't even know what sweetener is, actually. And they started to clean up the breakfast at 10:05, too. They call themselves a 4-star-hotel. But there is no way you can compare this hotel to a 4-star hotel in western countries. It hasn't even the standard of a Hotel Ibis. Anyway, comparing to a western standard, like in the States or European countries, this hotel would be more like a 1-star-hotel. And now about the positive things: The stuff was very friendly and helpful. They have a free and fast internet connection, the mini bar was complementary (but no diet stuff inside). I think they try to compensate the room size with more complementary stuff, which is okay. They really try hard to make your stay worthwhile, even they do not know how to serve breakfast and have extraordinarily small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Moon Hotel, Singapore met all my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: flyboytoo
Reviews.Content: The Moon Hotel is a small hotel but has great staff and facilities. Most rooms have no window and no lounge or sitting area but I knew that prior to booking (I was also advised at the time of check-in). The staff were fabulous and the rooms compact but very functional. A complimentary mini-bar is topped up each day with 2 beers, 2 waters, 2 soft drinks and 2 fruit juices. Complimentary breakfast and wireless internet are provided. Tea and coffee are available from 6.30am until 10.30pm as well as available in your room. Complimentary cocktails are available from 5-7pm each day (full range of spirits, aperitifs, beers and wine). I would not recommend this hotel to a family travelling with children but it definitely meets all the needs of a couple or a solo traveller. I will definitely use this hotel on any future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Brianhulbert
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Small windowless poorly lit room with bed mounted on a 50cm high plinth which provides a real hazard to moving about. No chairs or provision for cases, no privacy in toilet area and poor containment of shower water splatter. Air conditioning too cold in all areas Breakfast provision was near disaster with inadequate seating and poor replenishment of food stocks - many frustrated and annoyed guests. Positives: Colourful and interesting area. Hotel is generally clean and staff good but seem poorly organised. Complimentary drinks and wifi provision appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very small”
Reviews.Author: Bastien V
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean but the room are really small. Most of them has no windows. It like leaving in a box. Impossible to stop the air conditioning. The nights are cold.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: traveller197712
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January of this year. We were pleasantly surprised with our treatment. The staff was wonderful and helped us with our travel plans. The minibar in the room contains 2 beers, 2 bottles of juice, 2 waters, and 2 sodas and it refilled daily. This is included in the room charge and there was no additional charge for this! Also, every night they offer a free cocktail and breakfast is included. The price is very reasonable to have all of these perks! The hotel is also located very close to the Little India MTR station so it is very convenient to travel around the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a lovely mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: cilinlang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this hotel. The position is good, you can reach all the public transportation services within a very short walk. The room and bathroom were extremely clean but a a bit small. My room had a vey big window, flat TV and loads of amenities. Breakfast is also good, just the essential things that a normal person would eat. I really liked the design of this hotel and the fact that it's practically brand new. Good thing is also the free WiFi even in your room. The hotel staff is a bit sleepy if you ask me, but at the end of the day, once you already know what to do and how to move, you don't really need to rely on someone! I'd suggest this hotel as it is clean, new and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Well-designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xuan_10
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience staying at Moon Hotel with my husband. The place is well-designed, very sophisticated. The room is very cozy, well-equipped with amenities, toiletries are also provided. The hotel staff were very friendly, and their services were prompt. There were free minibar and evening cocktail. It was a little crowded during breakfast time as we went on a weekend, but the staff was quick in attending to our needs. We were very satisfied with the stay, and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a very short stay only!”
Reviews.Author: chouby
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review by sandygmaharaj. Plus points being, comfortable bed, clean, free wifi in rooms, complimentary minibar (not substantial, but inclusive), not bad location (in little india)..breakfast wasn't too bad, Bad points: teeny weeny rooms! (ok for a 1 night stay), clear glass in "bathroom", so only ideal for couples/single travellers, no window (too strange and personally felt unatural), Be careful on the sharp corners everywhere in this room - i stubbed my little toe - painful! Didn't have hot showers, water went everywhere outside the bathtub, unhelpful and disinterested staff and far too dim lighting. Overall, i could only recommend this hotel if you are a single traveller and wanted a place to crash and have a great night's sleep for one night...Any longer, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “No Windows, Really? Really, No Windows.”
Reviews.Author: 1whereintheworldami1
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews and I had assumed that the reviewer just had the bad luck of having an odd room with no window. In reality the only window on the 2nd and rd floor from whatI could tell were on the few rooms facing the street. Do not get me wrong, this hotel is done well for having VERY VERY small rooms. It is a good clean choice if you are making a quick overnight in Singapore. Staff is Friendly, Internet is free and fast, It is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staffs”
Reviews.Author: FranceBlueberry
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay in the hotel. Suite was even featured on the news on TV. I happened to see it when I was watching the news. The staffs are are helpful and pleasant. I lenjoyed the time when I get to chill out in the lounge to watch soccer with fans of the same soccer team.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: sandygmaharaj
Reviews.Content: Good points: a. Free internet b. Complimentary breakfast c. Complimentary minibar d. Location e. Bed Bad points: a. Small room b. No storage space. c. Poorly lit d. Stayed for 18 days...they provided only one set of accessories despite repeated requests. e. Smelly bathroom and aircon f. poor finishing of rooms. (Enamel on floors!!!) g. They suddenly stopped refilling juice in my mini-bar. On inquiry, they informed that they have changed their policy to request only refill h. Bathroom/toilet has a glass partition - hence, recommended only for partners. i. Most rooms are without windows j. Cost considering the space they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: kc128
Reviews.Content: i am a frequent traveler in view of my business. been to Singapore numerous trips, used to stay in cheap hotels but becos of noisiness, i came to know this hotel thru trip advisor website. booked online thru their website and confirmed with deluxe room for 2 nights. like what been mentioned by few reviewers on this website, deluxe rooms all occupied during check in and being upgraded to executive room which is about 100 singapore dollars more. counter service attendance was quite rude by passing sarcastic remarks that i check in too late and that if i am not satisfy, i can go to other hotel,when asking why deluxe room not available but confirmed by their website reservation. but becos i need to wash up and attend a meeting in 2 hours time, i kept quiet and check in but i only stayed for a night and shifted to Hotel 81 the next day which just a walking distance. the room was small, very dim even all lights switched on and no windows, the sink in the middle of the room, very small shower space. the best is all drinks in fridge are free, that inclusive 2 cans of san miguel beers, 2 cans of soft drinks, 2 small glass bottles of juice and 2 small bottles of mineral water. amenities only 1 set. the worst was the bed sheet really stained but they covered it with the amenities tray so you won't really notice it. but really strange for a boutique hotel that house keeping was done in early hours around 3am to 4.30am and it was annoying as i was woke up by the noise in the middle of my dream. well, trust me or not, this hotel should not bear the name of boutique hotel as the services and the environment of a budget hotel is much much more better than this hotel and the room for a budget hotel is more spacious than this hotel. travelers, please do think twice before you decide to make reservation with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a nicely renovated closet”
Reviews.Author: Innovamagik
Reviews.Content: Walked into the room and was shocked that the room surrounded one bed, no cupboard, and with a sink jutting out on the side. Complained abt the room size. Staff was helpful to switch to a room tat was a tiny bit bigger. Overall... Still tiny. I don't think calling it a boutique hotel justifies the price.

Reviews.Title: “don't come here with a suitcase”
Reviews.Author: TomRos
Reviews.Content: this is the smallest hotel room and worst value for money i have stayed in. anhywhere, including HK and London. the place tries to look fancy but just feels like staying in a prison cell for the price of a decent hotel. you could not possibly stay in this room (a deluxe, after I surrendered my "executive room" as it did not have a window!) with two people and one (!) normal suitcase. incredible! there simply would not be room to open it. I feel cheated here. a free mini bar does not make up for it, nor do awful colour schemes and a cheap painted concrete floor that smells like construction site (design hotel - yeah right!)... there are dozens of better places in SIN, incl. real design hotels and nice boutique hotels. don't stay here unless you don't like space and comfort at exorbitant rates! what a scam camouflaged as a "design hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, friendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: rinnie_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Very modern hotel with excellet facilities. The platform bed was extremely comfortable but I wouldn't recommend it for physically impaired or elderly people. The staff were very friendly. We had access to a free minibar plus happy hour 5-7 p.m. with free cocktails. The breakfast was great. Hotel was located In close proximity to Sim Lim Square for the technology mad. In all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rodith
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Moon Hotel for her birthday. The hotel is very clean and the staff are incredibly professional, helpful and friendly. Our room was great value with two hours of cocktails each evening and a 'continental breakfast' included. We were very pleasantly surprised to find that the breakfast included hot food, fresh fruit and pastries as well as the normal toast, cereal and yoghurt. All complaints regarding the room sizes are completely unfair as room sizes have been stated on each website we looked at. And really who goes to Singapore to sit in their room? The free wifi was great to look up things to do and which cocktails to drink each night! The amenties in the room were a great touch with loofahs, nail files, hairbrushes etc. and the free mini bar meant you could leave the hotel with a juice or water in your hand for the morning. We could not fault the hotel and their service, every staff member was lovely. We will most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable and pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Win26
Reviews.Content: Free help me write at www.tripadvisor.com Rooms small but value for money, beds comfortable, free high speed wifi, free mini bar, continental breakfast, executive lounge feel, full range n top quality ammenities.. Free cocktail session 5:30-7:30 daily Excellent location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Medira
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller, I tend to be a little more concerned when it comes to hotel stay... For Moon Hotel, i would give it thumbs up. What caught me by surprise was that the mini bar in room is not chargeable! Other hotels usually have mini bar items more expensive than those in the mart but in Moon, it's free! Absolutely love the amenities provided! Tip top quality with almost everything I need, including a nail file! Albeit the small room size, the comfortable bed and stylish design helps me get my beauty sleep In the morning, there's free continental breakfast in the cosy lounge area, and free wifi too! Most importantly, they have fantastic service! The staff helped me with my luggage when I checked in, never failed to smile at me whenever I entered the hotel and also hailed a cab for me to the airport! Definitely value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoy”
Reviews.Author: IndraZareen
Reviews.Content: The standard room ive booked have no windows. But what makes up for it is the free beverages i have in my room, complimentary breakfast, good wifi speed and i can have cocktail as well all at one reasonable price without worrying much. The location is not great but its convenient and the hotel staff take are always willing to offer their help. Overall i rate this hotel the best among the other hotels in the area because its new, value for money and the hospitality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “More than Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Winston_Lee
Reviews.Content: Pardon my virgin post as this the first time I think a boutique hotel is worth the write... Prior to booking the hotel, I had checked on the location and found that it is convenient for shopping of electronic goods at the local largest mall -Sim Lim Square, culture exploration - Little Indian Road? or Mustaff road? and its just minutes away from Orchard shopping district 1) Hotel Service is good, polite staff and GM - speak excellent English and good know-how of directions to my destination! Had great chatting sessions with the staffs 2) Nice free flow of coffee and local finger food, there's a free wine tasting session in the late afternoon which I regretfully missed! 3) Rooms are clean, fantastic bed, LCD TV,cosy, with free internet access, very very new! And yes....its kinda small but for the money I'm spending and amount of time we spent in the room, it doesn't really bother me 4) Disappointment is on the limited Luggage storage as I had a few parcels from the shopping trip at the electrical mall Overall, 5.5 stars service for this boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small room, No Windows!”
Reviews.Author: joffluex
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room for as a getaway with my boyfriend, was looking forward as the pictures look really nice on the website! But alas, it was disappointing! Upon checking in, was informed that our room has no windows. I asked if a room with window could be given and the guest officer offered to show us two rooms - one with window on the 4th flr and one without window on the 5th flr. However it turns out both deluxe rooms shown to us have no windows. It was clarified then by another officer that only Executive and Standard rooms have windows??!! (Now I'm not sure if even Standard rooms have windows as according to other reviews, there wasn't any windows in their standard room too!) Our request to change to an Executive room was rejected as our room was booked through a travel website, hence they are unable to change our booking! Sadly, we had to stick to our deluxe room despite willing to pay more money for the upgrade. Pros: - Excellent Location - All drinks in the fridge are free - Deluxe room has bathtub - Free Wifi Cons: - Space are maximized until it feels slightly claustrophobic - No windows (they did put in curtain though) - Only one set of amenities given (ie 1 toothbrush) - Only about 10 tv channels including local channels - Blue stains on our bedsheet which they attempted to hide by placing the amenities tray on the bed! If you're on budget, I think Hotel 81 will give u a similar space at lower costs. If you're looking for a hotel room whereby you want to have a good relaxing getaway with a bit more budget, I would say go down the street to Wanderlust Hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommend if you have Bulky carriage”
Reviews.Author: kozuwafey
Reviews.Content: I agree Hi, Just stayed on a week ago. The overall welcoming and lobby looks wonderful pleasant, thou a bit small. Then I was lead to my room, boy, its like a closet~ The room interior design was fantastic, Have big TV-on wall, Bed was so Comfy, nearly sucked to it, the amenities were complete, but the overall room space has just been reduced by half the normal hotel size. We would have expect our rooms to be more spacious with the value we purchase for the nights~ we've bought the deluxe type, thinking it would be more space, but the tub, you have to go thru the toilet, and its like jumping out of window to your small pool~ W wanted to upgrade the room, so I requested to view the difference of each room, standard to executive.. the room were same sq.ft, just differ by shower head and some design to make it look more spacious. We wanted to upgrade to Suite, but we're told its still under construction~ so we have no choice but to check-out the next day. Another this is I find the housekeeping staff were quite rude, we had the DND sign on, and lucky we had the room lock on, they open our door, and then knock, to say its housekeeping. Early morning, they were banging each and every room doors while cleaning it, I find it annoying! the breakfast were limited items and there's a complimentary cocktail from 5-7 pm, all the staff seems to enjoyed it alot~ overall this hotel, I would recommend if you are in Asian size, who looks for more fun, in different style, and short - stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not for everyone. Cozy best describes this, but great beds”
Reviews.Author: Peterf3088
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. This hotel opened around the 20th of September. So very new and obviously still need to fix fine details. They are really pitching at boutique. The rooms are nicely decorated and are definately small. Unfortunately, the only photos they have chosen to use on any bookings sites is of their biggest and best room, which they have 1 of. This was deceptive for me an complained after we got there and stayed 1 night. The first room had a window, but bed was in a corner with walls on three sides, so you got into bed both from one side. We complained and got another room with no window, which we didn't care about in the end. Staff were extremely helpful. Beds are great, extremely comfortable, and slept well in them. Location was awesome. Love Little India in Singapore. Easy access to MRT which gets you anywhere in Singapore. Breakfast was okay but don't expect full on buffet. Just simple breakfast and with scrambled eggs only. Last thing negative, shower seems to flood a little, which can be a pain. We stayed 3 nights and this was more than enough in a hotel like this. On the positive side, beds are great. I complained about the room and the duty manager responded quickly by offering different room, and discounting the first nights stay. When we returned that day, we found a bottle of wine and glasses in our room as an apology. They did try and this was appreciated. The girls at the counter were always friendly. The guy at reception that we think was gay was amazingly friendly and always made an effort. In the end, we enjoyed our stay. It wasn't cheap, or great value, but it was clean and new, and our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Really....dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: benjamin111
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the last stop on our tour of south-east asia. We booked the moon for two nights. Having been dropped off at the hotel door by the airport bus service we expected great things having seen photos online. We arrived reasonably late, around 11.45pm.The checkin took 35 mins...honestly. No queue either. Having booked a standard room, we werenot expecting a palatial paradise but for the money at least something larger. The room had no window! It was tiny, with nowhere to leave baggage. The sink for the bathroom was in the middle of the bedroom...very strange. There was a loud party opposite our room and the hotel did little to stop it. The aircon didnt turn off either. I am not a fussy traveller, but when you pay good money you expect good products and good service. We asked for a room with at least a window as not too fell like we were sampling Singapore's latest prison, but were told 'we could check out!'. We moved 5 mins up the road to a hotel called aqueen lavender. It was both cheaper and vastly superior...!

HotelInfo.Name: Moon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Dickson Rd | Little India, Singapore 209507, Singapore
